text: Sir William Gardiner, 1st Baronet (9 May 1628 - 23 June 1691) was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons in 1660. Gardiner was the son of Robert Gardiner of Wigan and his wife Mary Palmer.John Burke, John Bernard Burke A genealogical and heraldic history of the extinct and dormant baronetcies In 1660, Gardiner was elected Member of Parliament for Wigan in the Convention Parliament.History of Parliament Online - Gardiner, William He was made a Knight of the Bath at the coronation of King Charles II and was created Baronet of Roche Court in the same year on 2 December 1660. Gardiner died at the age of 63. Gardiner married Anne Brocas, daughter Robert Brocas of Beaurepaire, Hampshire, and had two sons Sir Brocas Gardiner, 2nd Baronet and Bernard. ==References== Category:1628 births Category:1691 deaths Category:People from Wigan Category:English MPs 1660 Category:Knights of the Bath Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of England Category:Cloth merchants Category:17th-century English businesspeople
title: Sir William Gardiner, 1st Baronet
